content.question: The Maclaurin series for g evaluated at x = 1/2 is an alternating series whose terms decrease in absolute value to 0. The approximation for g(1/2) using the first two nonzero terms of this series is 17/120. Show that this approximation differs from g(1/2) by less than 1/200.

frqParts.text: The Maclaurin series for g evaluated at x = 1/2 is an alternating series whose terms decrease in absolute value to 0. The approximation for g(1/2) using the first two nonzero terms of this series is 17/120. Show that this approximation differs from g(1/2) by less than 1/200.

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
